title: USTR Urges China To Embrace Market-Based Reforms
content:
,  4:55 PM ET) -- U.S. Trade Representative Michael Froman on Tuesday questioned China’s commitment to key market reforms, reiterating calls for the Asian powerhouse to transition to a more open, market-based economy as Chinese President Xi Jinping kicks off a visit to the U.S. 
In a speech at the Center for Strategic & International Studies, Froman pointed to China’s purported plan to require foreign firms to hand over technology or intellectual property as a “de facto” investment condition and use of anti-monopoly laws against foreign investors as out-of-sync with official policy....
